Description: 2004 McCarty made in USA.  Mahagony neck and body with marbled maple top.  Factory locking tuners (upgrade). Excellent player's guitar.  Set up perfectly and plays like butter. Frets are very good. Intonates well. Stays in tune very well.   Stock PRS McCarty Pickups. It is wired to have a split coil in both the bridge and neck positions which gives you a ton of tonal options.  The split coil sounds a little more like a single coil and the full on humbucker is just what you'd expect.  The guitar has numerous dings and scratches but nothing that effects the playability.  It also has some clear coat flaking off next to the fret board that is shown in the pictures.  It has been "loved" over the years.  I bought a PRS 594 and this guitar is too similar to justify keeping both.   This guitar is much better quality than anything Gibson has made in the last several decades, short of their custom shop models, and at a much better price.  Weighs just under 7lbs.  Comes with original hard shell case that also has some scratches and dings.  This is a good quality American built guitar and a fantastic value for the price. SHIPPING PRICE IS FOR CONTINENTAL US ONLY
Title: 2004 PRS MCcarty  Orig Hard Shell Case
ConditionDescription: Plays Excellent, but the cosmetics are a bit worn.  Not a museum piece. Several scratchs and dings.  Frets are good (minor wear towards the nut), the neck is straight, it plays like butter with low action, good intonation and no string buzz
